thread.title: Stunning space tourism poster imagines planet-hopping through TRAPPIST-1
thread.title_full: Stunning space tourism poster imagines planet-hopping through TRAPPIST-1

author: Mark Molloy
title: Stunning space tourism poster imagines planet-hopping through TRAPPIST-1
text:
N asa has imagined what life might be like in the newly discovered TRAPPIST-1 solar system with an imaginative space tourism photo.
The space agency says life may have evolved on three planets orbiting a dwarf star in the system, with astronomers hailing it as an ‚Äúaccelerated leap forward‚Äù in the search for extraterrestrial life.
Take a trip 40 light-years away to one of the seven Earth-sized planets in the TRAPPIST-1 system.

Download poster: https://t.co/t8N2ZsMXWV pic.twitter.com/CMiNUSGppi 
‚Äî NASA (@NASA) February 23, 2017 N asa‚Äôs colourful poster imagines a family of astounded visitors touching down on the fourth planet from the TRAPPIST-1 star, which is in the ‚Äúhabitable‚Äù zone.
‚ÄúTake a trip 40 light-years away to one of the seven Earth-sized planets in the TRAPPIST-1 system,‚Äù Nasa tweeted.
Trappist-1 planet discovery N asa added that TRAPPIST-1e would offer visitors ‚Äúheart-stopping views‚Äù and the chance of a ‚Äúplanet-hopping excursion‚Äù through the newly discovered system.
‚ÄúBrilliant objects in a red sky, looming like larger and smaller versions of our own moon. But these are no moons. They are other Earth-sized planets in a spectacular planetary system outside our own,‚Äù Nasa said.
Nasa discovers the TRAPPIST-1 Star with 7 Earth-size planets in its orbit, in pictures ‚ÄúThese seven rocky worlds huddle around their small, dim, red star, like a family around a campfire. Any of them could harbour liquid water, but the planet shown here, fourth from the TRAPPIST-1 star, is in the habitable zone, the area around the star where liquid water is most likely to be detected.‚Äù
U niversity of Cambridge's Amaury Triaud, one of the researchers involved in the project, said of the discovery: ‚ÄúWe've made a crucial step toward finding if there is life out there.‚Äù
@NASA @ProfBrianCox wait for 4.53 billion years for one, and then 7 come at once.
‚Äî Zappa's Muzzie (@ZappasMuzzie) February 23, 2017 M assachusetts Institute of Technology astrophysicist Sara Seager added: ‚ÄúWith this amazing system, we know that there must be many more potentially life-bearing worlds out there just waiting to be found.‚Äù
The TRAPPIST-1 announcement has also led to a host of social media jokes about Donald Trump building a space barrier .
More space tourism photos These are pretty cool! Space tourism posters https://t.co/rRVXpVYdHL #design #space #nasa @NASA pic.twitter.com/5oaKtcVi6E 
‚Äî Garda design (@gardadesign) January 28, 2017 @PulpLibrarian Did I send you the link to the NASA Space Tourism posters? pic.twitter.com/ySIWBPdTui 
‚Äî Paul Day (@DBD365) January 15, 2017 The people at NASA created some free space tourism posters, and they're pretty sweet: https://t.co/RVIHV8bVQq pic.twitter.com/WQr3eHCXal 
‚Äî Jenni üçâ (@madebyjenni) December 30, 2016 Exotic #Cosmic Locales Available as #Space Tourism Posters

via @NASAJPL https://t.co/kxFWruYa2c #Astronomy #NASA pic.twitter.com/U7F7ttLYyX 
‚Äî MR Humble (@Todd_Scheve) February 14, 2017
